body:
1. What version of Rust are you using (`rustc --version`)?
Beta 1.19 and Nightly 1.20 downloaded from - https://static.rust-lang.org/dist/rust-beta-powerpc64le-unknown-linux-gnu.tar.gz

2. What operating system and processor architecture are you using?
ppc64le, RedHat 7.3

3. What did you do?
Build tikv using make / make static_release
The build fails with the following error
error[E0432]: unresolved import `types::os::arch::c95::*`
   --> /root/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/libc-0.1.12/rust/src/liblibc/lib.rs:100:9
    |
100 | pub use types::os::arch::c95::*;
    |         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Could not find `arch` in `os`
... ...

4. Analysis so far:
Initially, I was suspecting that the libc crate is not ported for ppc64le, however, after interacting with the rust community, I found that support for ppc64le is available in the latest version of the libc crate.
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/42858

They suggest upgrading utime, nix and other tikv dependencies to the latest version for better platform compatibility. 

I am currently trying to understand what all might need to be updated- any pointers/thoughts on this would be of great help - thanks in advance!!

Regards,
Priya
title: tikv does not build on ppc64le
